TopicTitle: Best way to carry a rover?

Articles.Content:
So I just got a mission to Eve with a rover, but I found the method I was using to land it nearly destroyed the rover, and left it without enough power to run non-stop (total damage 3 RTGs, the Mechjeb module, and a battery). The method of landing the rover involves ejecting it out of the 3.75m fairing, then docking it under the lander, so the lander can safely undock with the rover when it's on the ground, but the legs clip through the wheels which messes with the physics and tends to make stuff blow up when it's undocked. I use FAR so I have to everything aerodynamically. Here's a few pictures of the lander combo:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Edit: I can use a SkyCrane approach where I drop it while hovering and then land next to it, but I'd prefer to detach after landing, as it's a bit simpler.

Since it's Eve you could bolt a parachute to the top of it and shoot the rest of the lander away.
I do mine like yours but this is a 60 ton(with cargo) lander with a 8 ton cargo(Not yet tested for heavier objects). I have the legs spread to allow access to wide wheeled rovers and big payloads.
